fact: Barancles eat with their legs.
Blue sharks are highly migratory animals.
Butchart Gardens has 26 green houses.
Canadian geese mate for life.
The original Capilano Suspension Bridge was built in 1889, with hemp rope and cedar planks.
The three main groups of species currently cultured in B.C waters include salmon and other finfish, shellfish and marine plants.
Giant Pacific Octopi are known to be intoverted.

The Grouse Mountain Skyride is an 850M ascent to the peak of Vancouver.
Seals have large eyes to see in dark, deep water.
Harbour Air has over 500,000 passengers a year.

Humpback whales can grow up to 18 meters long.

Little brown bats are nocturnal and hunt most actively for a few hours after dusk.
Loons are carnivores.

The Tufted Puffin is the largest puffin.
